intro: Mitreola tracyi, commonly known as the Tracy's mitreola, is a small, herbaceous plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap. The plant typically has small, ovate leaves and produces tiny, clustered yellow flowers. It is often found in moist, shaded environments within the rainforest understory. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in plant morphology and ecology.
